pr_title: Resteasy: do not use Jandex's ClassInfo in a Set

timeline.message: Resteasy: do not use Jandex's ClassInfo in a Set, since it implements neither equals() nor hashCode()

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't these be outside of the if (!withoutDefaultCtor.containsKey(clazz.name())) check?
timeline.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: If it's in withoutDefaultCtor it's already been processed, hasn't it?
replies.author: aloubyansky

replies.bodyText:
That is certainly true, but the point of withoutDefaultCtor wasn't really to guard against that case.
I do understand what your checking here, it just seems odd to reuse withoutDefaultCtor to perform this check.
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: I could introduce another Set for that purpose.
replies.author: aloubyansky
